Ecclesiasticus *__07.1: Do no evils, and no evils shall lay hold of thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.2: Depart from the unjust, and evils shall depart from thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.3: My son, sow not evils in the furrows of injustice, and thou shalt not reap them sevenfold.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.4: Seek not of the Lord a pre-eminence, nor of the king the seat of honour.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.5: Justify not thyself before God, for he knoweth the heart: and desire not to appear wise before the king.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.6: Seek not to be made a judge, unless thou have strength enough to extirpate iniquities: lest thou fear the person of the powerful, and lay a stumblingblock for thy integrity.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.7: Offend not against the multitude of a city, neither cast thyself in upon the people,
Ecclesiasticus *__07.8: Nor bind sin to sin: for even in one thou shalt not be unpunished.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.9: Be not fainthearted in thy mind:
Ecclesiasticus *__07.10: Neglect not to pray, and to give alms.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.11: Say not: God will have respect to the multitude of my gifts, and when I offer to the most high God, he will accept my offerings.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.12: Laugh no man to scorn in the bitterness of his soul: for there is one that humbleth and exalteth, God who seeth all.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.13: Devise not a lie against thy brother: neither do the like against thy friend.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.14: Be not willing to make any manner of lie: for the custom thereof is not good.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.15: Be not full of words in a multitude of ancients, and<u>repeat not</u>the word in thy prayer.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.16: Hate not laborious works, nor husbandry ordained by the most High.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.17: Number not thyself among the multitude of the disorderly.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.18: Remember wrath, for it will not tarry long.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.19: Humble thy spirit very much: for the vengeance on the flesh of the ungodly is fire and worms.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.20: Do not transgress against thy friend deferring money, nor despise thy dear brother for the sake of gold.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.21: Depart not from a wise and good wife, whom thou hast gotten in the fear of the Lord: for the grace of her modesty is above gold.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.22: Hurt not the servant that worketh faithfully, nor the hired man that giveth thee his life.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.23: Let a wise servant be dear to thee as thy own soul, defraud him not of liberty, nor leave him needy.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.24: Hast thou cattle? have an eye to them: and if they be for thy profit, keep them with thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.25: Hast thou children? instruct them, and bow down their neck from their childhood.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.26: Hast thou daughters? have a care of their body, and shew not thy countenance gay towards them.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.27: Marry thy daughter well, and thou shalt do a great work, and give her to a wise man.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.28: If thou hast a wife according to thy soul, cast her not off: and to her that is hateful, trust not thyself. With thy whole heart,
Ecclesiasticus *__07.29: Honour thy father, and forget not the groanings of thy mother:
Ecclesiasticus *__07.30: Remember that thou hadst not been born but through them: and make a return to them as they have done for thee.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.31: With all thy soul fear the Lord, and reverence his priests.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.32: With all thy strength love him that made thee: and forsake not his ministers.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.33: Honour God with all thy soul, and give honour to the priests, and purify thyself with<u>thy arms</u>.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.34: Give them their portion, as it is commanded thee, of the firstfruits and of purifications: and for thy negligences purify thyself with a few.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.35: Offer to the Lord the gift of thy shoulders, and the sacrifice of sanctification, and the firstfruits of the holy things:
Ecclesiasticus *__07.36: And stretch out thy hand to the poor, that thy expiation and thy blessing may be perfected.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.37: A gift hath grace in the sight of all the living,<u>and restrain not grace from the dead</u>.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.38: Be not wanting in comforting them that weep, and walk with them that mourn.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.39: Be not slow to visit the sick: for by these things thou shalt be confirmed in love.
Ecclesiasticus *__07.40: In all thy works remember thy last end, and thou shalt never sin.
